text: A slip-turn is a maneuver in which an aircraft turns using only the rudder. In most aircraft, the presence of a fixed vertical stabilizer complicates the maneuver. However, in those in which the whole of the vertical stabilizer comprises the rudder, such as the Fokker Dr.I triplane, the aircraft can be made to effectively skid in the horizontal plane, a technique employed by the German World War I ace Josef JacobsFranks p218 to great effect, and which Werner Voss used in his final combat. ==Notes== ==References== * Norman Franks : Dog-Fight: Aerial Tactics of the Aces of World War I (2003) Category:Aerial maneuvers
title: Slip-turn
